metadata.title: CVE-2016-1579 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
UDM provides support for running commands after a download is completed,this is currently made use of for click package installation. Thisfunctionality was not restricted to unconfined applications. Before UDMversion 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1 any confined application could make useof the UDM C++ API to run arbitrary commands in an unconfined environmentas the phablet user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1579` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libubuntu-download-manager-client1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
libubuntu-download-manager-common1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
libubuntu-upload-manager-common1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
libudm-common1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
libudm-priv-common1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
qtdeclarative5-ubuntu-download-manager0.1 - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-download-manager - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-upload-manager - 1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ubuntu-download-manager package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2+16.04.20160408-0ubuntu1').
